ovdesc.p: This application is used to capture the mandate information like Customer Bank sort code, Customer Account name, Account number, clearing reference, mandate status etc.

The ID to this application is a valid Globus Internal / Customer account for which Direct Debit mandate is received. Currently mandate can be given only for account whose currency is equal to company's local currency.
This mandate can be linked to MORTGAGE application when the Status is "AVAILABLE" or "ACTIVE" and based on MG schedule date, claim is raised automatically.

Claims for a mandate when it falls due on a same value date can be combined as a single claim and claim file can be sent with single claim instead of multiple claims.

When this field is set to "Yes", then the DD.ITEMs created for the same DD.DDI will be merged together while generating the Outward claim file and sent as a single claim entry with the details from the first DD.ITEM.

Please note the Claim generation, reversal, return and accounting entries are raised for each item under the mandate. Only during file generation process, based on the COMBINE.DD.ITEMS field, Claim amounts are combined and single claim is sent. To combine the items during file generation process the DD.SAMPLE.ROUTINE has to attached in DD.OUT.FORMAT for the Amount data field.
Refer to DD user guide - DD.OUT.FORMAT section more details.

Identifies the Date & Frequency of the Standalone DD for execution.
The claim value date is the date component of this field. Hence the date & the frequency has to be given after considering the Claim value date as given in DD.PARAMETER.
The date is cycled with the given frequency and this mandate reference is updated in DD.STANDALONE.FQU.LIST with the next execution date.

Whenever the frequency is modified, then the underlying claim (DD.ITEM) is marked as "DELETED" and new claim is raised for the given frequency. Incase the Claim is already sent(DD.ITEM status is "CLAIMSENT"), then override is raised. However the DD.ITEM will not be marked as "DELETED" as claim file is already generated.
Mandatory when STAND.ALONE.DDI set to Yes

This field is sub-divided into two elements: 1. Date 1-9 type D (date format in range 1950-2049) characters. 2. Optional Frequency 1-5 type SS (uppercase alpha or numeric, first character alpha) characters. (Mandatory input)
The date input or generated will correspond to the first execution of the Standalone DD.
Using the date & frequency in case given , DD.STANDALONE.FQU.LIST is updated with the next execution date.
An override will be required if the date input is a non-working day.
Date entered should be greater than today and should not be more than Termination date.

Id for the application is an account for which mandate is given, prefixed with "D-" and suffixed with ".Sequence Number".
ID can be given just as an Account Number and system formats the Accounts number with a prefix of "D-" & suffix ".Sequence Number".
Reversal function is not allowed for this application and DDI can be marked as Inactive by changing the the Status of DDI to "CANCELLED.DDI".
Standard numeric Account number or 3-10 character Account Mnemonic (uppercase alpha, numeric or .) - type MNE. or 6-12 character Internal Account Number (uppercase alpha or numeric) - type SS.
Account currency should be equal to Local currency.
Format is "D-""Account Number"".Sequence Number wherein Input of Account number is mandatory.
